subject: Christopher Vega paid you $100.00
Upcoming changes to Figma’s pricing, seats, and billing experience
body:
Since we first launched Figma in 2016, our features and products have expanded,
but our billing experience hasn’t kept pace.

Starting on March 11, 2025, we will be making the following changes to our
pricing, seats, and billing experience
[https://figma.com/blog/billing-experience-update-2025/]:


 * Increased pricing for Figma Design—see below table for details
 * Re-architecture of our billing model—we are moving away from user-driven
   upgrades to giving admins upfront approval over seat upgrades by default
 * More functionality with every seat—all paid seats will include access to
   FigJam and Figma Slides, making it easier for everyone to collaborate


PLANS AND SEATS

Full seat includes Figma Design, Dev Mode, FigJam, and Figma Slides. Pricing:
Professional $16/mo billed annually; Organization $55/mo; Enterprise $90/mo |
Dev seat includes Dev Mode, FigJam, and Figma Slides. Pricing: Professional
$12/mo billed annually; Organization $25/mo; Enterprise $35/mo | Collab seat
includes FigJam and Figma Slides. Pricing: Professional $3/mo billed annually;
Organization $5/mo; Enterprise $5/mo | View seat includes view/comment access
and is free on all plans.
[https://static.figma.com/uploads/6fd77bcbca808d1a8cbbbf44476736826583084f]https://figma.com/blog/billing-experience-update-2025/

Our free Starter plan will continue to be available. Prices reflected above are in USD. If you pay for Figma today using a different currency, you can view the updated pricing in that currency here:
[https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/27468498501527-Updates-to-Figma-s-pricing-seats-and-billing-experience#localized-currency]



Beginning March 11, 2025, all paid seats will include FigJam and Figma Slides
and admins will get access to new seat upgrade approval flows.

Starting on your first renewal on or after March 11, 2025:

 * Increased pricing for Figma Design will be reflected in the updated cost of a
   Full seat. Learn more →
   [https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/27468498501527-Updates-to-Figma-s-pricing-seats-and-billing-experience#h_01JBZ7SGJ9WFXK9JTMZ0X18Z50]
 * Approved seats will be added to your next invoice and prorated from the day
   of approval through the end of your subscription period. Learn more →
   [https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/27468498501527-Updates-to-Figma-s-pricing-seats-and-billing-experience#01JCRVKQ4RB2GFBE7GWZSAQ800]

Check your renewal date
[https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/27468498501527-Updates-to-Figma-s-pricing-seats-and-billing-experience#plan-renewal]
to find out when these billing changes will go into effect for your plan. By continuing with your renewal, you agree to these subscription pricing and billing changes.

Looking for more information?

 * Watch a video walk-through
   [https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/27468498501527-Updates-to-Figma-s-pricing-seats-and-billing-experience#video]
 * Visit the Help Center
   [https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/27468498501527-Updates-to-Figma-s-pricing-seats-and-billing-experience?chatStartExpanded]
   to learn more about these changes or get in touch with our Support team

Thank you,
The Figma Team

Figma is a design platform for teams who build products together. Born on the
Web, Figma helps the entire product team create, test, and ship better designs,
faster.

Figma
[https://static.figma.com/uploads/a9c9c230c0a9395f5eaa1c4acb6ee89d13782987]

subject: Sessions 2025: Agenda preview
body:
[Stripe Sessions - May 6-8, 2025] <https://info-link.stripe.com/MDcyLU1ESy0yODMAAAGXUJFQ06K9qzZD5SB4t60WOjOiB3dtwED0MT-rhim4hVbVTYbYheellPCxIKfkIU1uH6tkDLk=>

Hello,

Preparations are well underway for Stripe Sessions 2025—our annual event that brings together leaders within the payments and financial technology ecosystem. I hope you’ll join us there, May 6–8, at Moscone West in San Francisco.

For 2025, we’re focused on the topics that have the most potential to move your business forward—like revenue models of the future and practical applications of AI in product development.

We’re also looking at how to meet emerging global trends head-on, and we’ll showcase some really interesting examples of novel payment experiences that can enhance customer satisfaction and loyalty.

We’re offering a select group complimentary admission. Register today with your unique code MK25I203531317 for a complimentary pass. Codes are nontransferable.

Register now <https://info-link.stripe.com/MDcyLU1ESy0yODMAAAGXUJFQ06K9qzZD5SB4t60WOjOiB3dtwED0MT-rhim4hVbVTYbYheellPCxIKfkIU1uH6tkDLk=>

Stay tuned for more.

John Collison
Cofounder and President, Stripe


This email was sent to me@mattborn.com. If you'd rather not receive this kind of email, you can unsubscribe or manage your email preferences. <https://info-link.stripe.com/MDcyLU1ESy0yODMAAAGXUJFQ1FKdA57cofLUQOVtC3_jkPa1uHkD8No7FKvIIjI_MCGEQWmcKPND43gxazUPPBQYyy8=>

subject: Upcoming changes to Figma’s pricing, seats, and billing experience
body:
Since we first launched Figma in 2016, our features and products have expanded,
but our billing experience hasn’t kept pace.

Starting on March 11, 2025, we will be making the following changes to our
pricing, seats, and billing experience
[https://figma.com/blog/billing-experience-update-2025/]:


 * Increased pricing for Figma Design—see below table for details
 * Re-architecture of our billing model—we are moving away from user-driven
   upgrades to giving admins upfront approval over seat upgrades by default
 * More functionality with every seat—all paid seats will include access to
   FigJam and Figma Slides, making it easier for everyone to collaborate


PLANS AND SEATS

Full seat includes Figma Design, Dev Mode, FigJam, and Figma Slides. Pricing:
Professional $16/mo billed annually; Organization $55/mo; Enterprise $90/mo |
Dev seat includes Dev Mode, FigJam, and Figma Slides. Pricing: Professional
$12/mo billed annually; Organization $25/mo; Enterprise $35/mo | Collab seat
includes FigJam and Figma Slides. Pricing: Professional $3/mo billed annually;
Organization $5/mo; Enterprise $5/mo | View seat includes view/comment access
and is free on all plans.
[https://static.figma.com/uploads/6fd77bcbca808d1a8cbbbf44476736826583084f]https://figma.com/blog/billing-experience-update-2025/

Our free Starter plan will continue to be available. Prices reflected above are in USD. If you pay for Figma today using a different currency, you can view the updated pricing in that currency here:
[https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/27468498501527-Updates-to-Figma-s-pricing-seats-and-billing-experience#localized-currency]



Beginning March 11, 2025, all paid seats will include FigJam and Figma Slides
and admins will get access to new seat upgrade approval flows.

Starting on your first renewal on or after March 11, 2025:

 * Increased pricing for Figma Design will be reflected in the updated cost of a
   Full seat. Learn more →
   [https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/27468498501527-Updates-to-Figma-s-pricing-seats-and-billing-experience#h_01JBZ7SGJ9WFXK9JTMZ0X18Z50]
 * Approved seats will be added to your next invoice and prorated from the day
   of approval through the end of your subscription period. Learn more →
   [https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/27468498501527-Updates-to-Figma-s-pricing-seats-and-billing-experience#01JCRVKQ4RB2GFBE7GWZSAQ800]

Check your renewal date
[https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/27468498501527-Updates-to-Figma-s-pricing-seats-and-billing-experience#plan-renewal]
to find out when these billing changes will go into effect for your plan. By continuing with your renewal, you agree to these subscription pricing and billing changes.

Looking for more information?

 * Watch a video walk-through
   [https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/27468498501527-Updates-to-Figma-s-pricing-seats-and-billing-experience#video]
 * Visit the Help Center
   [https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/27468498501527-Updates-to-Figma-s-pricing-seats-and-billing-experience?chatStartExpanded]
   to learn more about these changes or get in touch with our Support team

Thank you,
The Figma Team

Figma is a design platform for teams who build products together. Born on the
Web, Figma helps the entire product team create, test, and ship better designs,
faster.

Figma
[https://static.figma.com/uploads/a9c9c230c0a9395f5eaa1c4acb6ee89d13782987]

subject: Moona’s weekly task reminder
body:
Gusto
[Gusto] (https://gusto.com)


Just a reminder: Here are Moona’s tasks this week. Sign in to Gusto to review all tasks.

## Due this week ##
----------------------------------------


Due Thu Dec 12


## Add any contractors to Gusto ##
----------------------------------------

To help us correctly generate 1099s, add all active and dismissed contractors who worked for Moona in 2024 to Gusto. No contractors to add? Let us know by completing this task—it only takes a second.

Let’s do it (https://app.gusto.com/redirect/todos/email?email_id=bb613816e195ed22e2c26c79&email_type=PAYROLL_ADMIN_DIGEST_REMINDER&notification_id=53220803-fa78-40b4-bbf2-5e3297161a42&x_role_id=7757869456144801)


Due Thu Dec 12


## Enter any payrolls processed outside of Gusto in 2024 ##
----------------------------------------

Help us accurately calculate taxes and generate W-2s by entering payrolls for all employees—including those who were dismissed. Don’t have any outside payrolls to report? Complete or dismiss this task to let us know.

Let’s do it (https://app.gusto.com/redirect/todos/email?email_id=bb613816e195ed22e2c26c79&email_type=PAYROLL_ADMIN_DIGEST_REMINDER&notification_id=f4845b7a-d8ea-4df5-ac1f-02b695604f02&x_role_id=7757869456144801)


Due Thu Dec 12


## Add any applicable company exemptions ##
----------------------------------------

Exemptions aren’t common, but if any apply to Moona or its employees, add them now to help us accurately calculate taxes. No updates? Complete or dismiss this task to let us know.

Let’s do it (https://app.gusto.com/redirect/todos/email?email_id=bb613816e195ed22e2c26c79&email_type=PAYROLL_ADMIN_DIGEST_REMINDER&notification_id=38f1462c-f476-4cf0-9a6b-7b4e33cc18b6&x_role_id=7757869456144801)


## Due last week ##
----------------------------------------

No tasks due last week.
View all tasks (https://app.gusto.com/moona/payroll_admin)

Content older than one year will be deleted from your free workspace starting January 28th, 2025
body:
Content older than one year will be deleted starting January 28th, 2025

This is a notice that starting January 28th, 2025, messages and files older than one year will be deleted from your free workspace if you remain on the free Slack plan. To retain access to content older than a year, your workspace needs to be on a Slack paid plan. Slack plans can be reviewed on our plan page [https://slack.com/pricing].

If your team chooses to upgrade to a paid plan after the policy goes into effect, you will not be able to recover any content that is deleted under our new policy.

Slack’s policy change for free workspaces

In June 2024 we announced that we have changed our policy [https://slack.com/help/articles/29414264463635] for free workspace message and file storage. Content in free workspaces—including messages, files, and other content—that is older than a year will be deleted. Free workspaces will continue to have full access to the past 90 days of message history and file storage.

This change does not impact workspaces on other Slack plans, such as Slack Pro.

Questions? Review our FAQs [https://slack.com/help/articles/29414264463635] about this policy change and sign in [https://slack.com/workspace-signin] to view all your workspaces.

subject: Keep your Apple Account safe and secure.
body:
Apple Account
 

-----------------------------


Let’s check up on your Apple Account.
Take a few important steps to keep your data safe and secure.
 


Know how to reset your password
Don't remember your password? There are multiple safe and secure ways to reset it.

Learn more
https://geni.us/Password
 


Keep your contact information up to date
Your primary email address is how Apple safely stays in touch with you. Confirm your primary email address, and add a secondary one if you'd like.

Verify now
https://account.apple.com/account/manage
 


Set up a recovery contact
Make it easy to regain access to your Apple Account if you forget your password or get locked out of your account. Ask a trusted friend or family member to be your recovery contact so they can help Apple to verify your identity.

Get set up
https://account.apple.com/account/manage
 


Choose a legacy contact
A legacy contact helps a loved one access photos, files, and other types of data after your death.

Learn more
https://account.apple.com/account/manage
 

Recovery contact: Your contacts will need an iOS device with iOS 15 or iPadOS 15 or later, or Mac with macOS Monterey or later, and must meet the minimum requirements.

Legacy contact: requires iOS 15.2, iPadOS 15.2, and macOS 12.1 or later. 
 To use iCloud you need at least iOS 10 on iPhone 5, iPod touch (6th generation), iPad (4th generation) or iPad mini 2; watchOS 3 on an Apple Watch; macOS Sierra 10.12 on a Mac; tvOS 4 on an Apple TV (4th generation); or visionOS 1 on an Apple Vision Pro.; or a PC with Windows 11 or later (Outlook 2019 or later or an up-to-date browser is required for accessing email, contacts, and calendars). Some features require iOS 16, iPadOS 16, and macOS Ventura. Some features require a Wi-Fi connection. Some features are not available in all countries or regions. Access to some services is limited to 10 devices.


All rights reserved. Copyright © 2024 Apple Inc. One Apple Park Way, Cupertino, CA 95014.


Privacy Policy
https://www.apple.com/legal/privacy/en-ww/

Terms & Conditions
https://www.apple.com/legal/internet-services/icloud/

Support
https://support.apple.com/icloud

Account
https://account.apple.com/account/manage

Subscribe
https://account.apple.com/

subject: Invitation: Daily Demo - AI Recruiter @ Mon Dec 9, 2024 2pm - 2:30pm (PST) (me@mattborn.com)
TT4D: How to Effectively Complete a Quad Chart for Government Research Projects
body:
View this post on the web at https://stanfordh4d.substack.com/p/tt4d-how-to-effectively-complete

How long do people watch a TikTok or Instagram reel, YouTube or movie trailer content before swiping right? Not long. Attention is a commodity. The same applies to researchers wishing to capture a program manager’s attention with the value of a research project.
Companies use something called an “elevator pitch.” An elevator pitch is a brief 30-second introduction to a company or product. It sets the tone and conveys one or two key points that can be clearly understood in the time it takes to ride an elevator. The goal is to engage the listener and hook them into wanting to continue the conversation.
The quad chart is an elevator pitch for the research world. The goal is to communicate the value of a research project so program managers (PMs) are motivated to learn more.
Because decision-makers rely heavily on this document during funding reviews, it is essential to approach its preparation with precision and care. Below is a step-by-step guide to help researchers craft an effective quad chart while avoiding common pitfalls.
What is a Quad Chart?
A quad chart is a concise one-page document highlighting a specific research project. It gives researchers an opportunity to succinctly convey the concept, value, goals, and progress of the work. The chart is divided into quadrants where each is dedicated to articulating a specific aspect of the research project: 1) start/end dates, 2) The individuals involved in the research, 3) research objectives and 4) milestones and accomplishments.
Why use a Quad Chart?
A compelling quad chart will help secure or retain funding from a PM. PMs use quad charts to quickly assess research projects to determine if the research aligns with their program goals. If so, the PM will request additional information such as a white paper or full proposal. The quad chart is a critical first step in obtaining funding for your research. Quad charts are also used by PMs to assess ongoing research projects.. PMs use quad charts to stay updated on a project's progress and use their content to brief their bosses.
Layout Overview
Each of the four quadrants serves a distinct purpose. Researchers must familiarize themselves with each of the quadrants to concisely convey the value of their research.
The top-left quadrant is an opportunity to visually hook the reader with an image. The image will be the first thing they will see so it should be visually engaging and understandable. Depicting research prototypes, simulations, or other compelling images will serve this purpose. Avoid technical diagrams or overly detailed visuals, and instead choose a clear image that conveys the essence of your work. Include the start date and anticipated end date under the image.
The top-right quadrant provides details about the research team. List the key members including students, professors, and government collaborators – their roles in the project, affiliation, and contact information.
The bottom-left quadrant focuses on the project’s objectives. This section should outline research goals in simple, clear terms that align with the funding organization’s mandate and priorities. For instance, “The goal is to develop a sodium ion battery with x times the state-of-the-art (SOA) cycle life and 550-750 Wh/L energy density to increase the endurance and longevity of naval undersea vehicles.” Make sure the objectives are actionable and quantitative. Avoid vague or overly broad statements like “to innovate energy storage systems” and instead focus on specific, achievable goals. Linking your research to Army, Air Force, or Navy priorities is essential. See this post [ https://substack.com/redirect/e603e268-d467-4b0d-bde0-28c4d6e8a8df?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ] for more.
Finally, the bottom-right quadrant should detail the project’s schedule, milestones, and current status. This section includes a high-level timeline, major milestones, and recent accomplishments. For example, highlight items like “Prototype testing has been completed with 20% higher efficiency compared to existing models. If appropriate, consider using a Gantt chart or bullet points for clarity. This quadrant provides the PM and reviewers with a clear assessment of progress and demonstrates that the project is on track. For projects that have not been funded, this quadrant should contain the specific milestones that must be met to achieve the research objectives.
List any prestigious awards or accolades a researcher has won to demonstrate the research project’s value.. This information establishes the impact and collaborative nature of the research project. Be concise and ensure all contact information is accurate and up-to-date.
Tips for Creating a Compelling Quad Chart
Consider the value: Articulate the novelty of your research project. What makes it different from the state-of-the-art? What makes it important?
Tailor the content: Consider who will read the quad and why they should support it.
Align each quadrant to support a common message: The timeline of the project and research team should be aligned to the goals and milestones of the project. The objectives and the impact of potential results should be clearly stated and be proportionate to the timeline, personnel, and budget.
Focus on the value it could provide: Explain how your research can directly address the needs and priorities of the PM’s organization.
Common Mistakes to Avoid
When preparing your quad chart, there are several pitfalls to avoid. A cluttered layout can overwhelm reviewers, so ensure your content is well-organized and easy to read. Avoid adding excessive text or visuals, as this can dilute your message. Unclear objectives can undermine your proposal’s credibility. Approach the quad chart with a “less is more” mentality with the goal to hook the reader into wanting to learn more. Make sure your goals are specific and directly tied to the funding organization’s mandate and priorities. Outdated information, such as old POC details or milestones, can hurt your submission, so double-check that all content is accurate and current. Quadrants should support each other.. For instance, the start/end time should be proportionate to the research objectives and the milestones sought.
Final Checklist
Before submitting your quad chart, review it thoroughly. Ask yourself the following questions:
Is the layout visually balanced or are quadrants crowded or underutilized?
Does the image in the top-left quadrant compellingly and effectively represent your project?
Are all point-of-contact details accurate and easy to find?
Is the content provided tied to the funding organization’s priority?
Are your objectives clearly stated, specific, and quantitative?
Is the schedule/milestones quadrant concise and up-to-date?
By addressing these questions, you can ensure your quad chart will succinctly make a strong case for funding your research.
Conclusion
In the competitive landscape of defense research, a well-crafted quad chart can be the key to securing and continuing funding for your project. It is not just a summary; it is a reflection of your project’s value and potential impact. A thoughtfully prepared quad chart demonstrates to reviewers that you understand DoD priorities and are capable of delivering impactful results.
By following this guide, you can create a quad chart that is both informative and visually compelling. This document is your opportunity to make a strong first impression and communicate the value of your research.. A great quad chart can set your proposal apart, showcasing your project as a valuable investment for advancing defense technology.
________________________________________________________________
Technology Transfer for Defense (TT4D) at Stanford University specializes in matching Defense Department funding with academic research projects. In the past six years, TT4D has worked with numerous faculty members at more than a dozen universities to help them win Defense Department grants and with the Office of Naval Research, totaling more than $13 million, to support research funding and transition academic technologies from lab to defense capabilities. TT4D is based at Stanford University and is run by  [ https://substack.com/redirect/73567e2c-619a-4a75-b116-c8c51f57e78f?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ]Jeffrey Decker, PhD [ https://substack.com/redirect/73567e2c-619a-4a75-b116-c8c51f57e78f?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ], program director, Precourt Institute for Energy,  [ https://substack.com/redirect/d55b65ae-e635-4072-8bb2-4d2ade1efad0?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ]Fu-Kuo Chang [ https://substack.com/redirect/d55b65ae-e635-4072-8bb2-4d2ade1efad0?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ], professor of Aeronautics and Astronautics, and  [ https://substack.com/redirect/5df9b9bd-9f3d-42d3-91a3-a9f17c985af3?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ]Nilay Papila, [ https://substack.com/redirect/5df9b9bd-9f3d-42d3-91a3-a9f17c985af3?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ]  [ https://substack.com/redirect/5df9b9bd-9f3d-42d3-91a3-a9f17c985af3?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ]PhD [ https://substack.com/redirect/5df9b9bd-9f3d-42d3-91a3-a9f17c985af3?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ], [ https://substack.com/redirect/5df9b9bd-9f3d-42d3-91a3-a9f17c985af3?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ] senior program manager, Precourt Institute for Energy. To contact the TT4D team, visit techtransferfordefense.stanford.edu [ https://substack.com/redirect/1c15caba-d74f-40a4-a0a9-3b0f94aa0aaf?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ].
To read previous TT4D posts, see:
TT4D: Getting Defense Department Grants [ https://substack.com/redirect/f3953406-e34b-49b1-8fb9-adcdcae43510?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ]
TT4D: Tech Transfer for Defense's 4-Step Guide to Winning Defense Department Research Funding [ https://substack.com/redirect/9f3fcbb0-c16a-4777-8b67-9ddff5ad064f?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ]
TT4D: How to Find Existing Research Broad Agency Announcements [ https://substack.com/redirect/d075192b-f6c4-4715-9efa-cee72fab78d1?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ]
TT4D: Contacting the Program Manager and Seeking Feedback [ https://substack.com/redirect/2c456a5a-ec8d-498f-aacf-ad85aac9d02f?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ]
Technology Transfer for Defense: Leveraging the Heilmeier Catechism: A Blueprint for Effective Project Framing [ https://substack.com/redirect/d1d481da-03e4-4632-b538-c439b9fe9df2?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ]
TT4D and Researchers Looking for Government Financing $$$: Prepare and Submit Your Application [ https://substack.com/redirect/c9e9b8a2-7ddc-44e7-8eca-82e5216eb968?j=eyJ1IjoiNHF4MG9uIn0.EGIUcbKcuH6xTNPBO8JoQ-85NOYTo2QNbkKBKX1owwY ]

HBR compliance report & 2025 compliance calendar inside!
body:
TriNet 
<https://app.hr.trinet.com/e/er?s=1487871083&lid=13492&elqTrackId=c0461f88a43244e891bc294d65102bed&elq=c774976136b540a584c093d9c7735768&elqaid=9265&elqat=1&elqak=8AF50B8C12FDFB5ADD1FC3C493D9F8D1C8BFF280EDC92C5C66498D7C309C37F2481C>                  

Weekly Roundup                   

Stress a bit less with two powerful HR compliance guides

We’ve put two of our top HR compliance performers into this edition. First, there’s the Harvard Business Review Report, Confronting HR Compliance Challenges Small and Medium-Size Businesses Face, filled with data that can help with strategy and decision-making. Second, there’s our 2025 HR Compliance Calendar, a must-have for any HR administrator trying to stay on top of HR compliance deadlines. Put them together and you’ll have a jump on your HR compliance plans for 2025—and that much less to worry about.

87% of survey respondents agree that organizations face significant business risk  if they don’t prioritize HR compliance.  

Download the HBR Report  → 
<https://app.hr.trinet.com/e/er?s=1487871083&lid=13497&elqTrackId=2c77edd96407472ca656d3d124b6d2b2&elq=c774976136b540a584c093d9c7735768&elqaid=9265&elqat=1&elqak=8AF53C97F862910B45D064EBF9D6F03C0232F280EDC92C5C66498D7C309C37F2481C>                      

Confronting HR Compliance Challenges Small and Medium-Sized Businesses Face

Ensuring your company policies and actions adhere to evolving employment-related rules and regulations takes time, effort, and expertise. Doing so effectively involves everything from keeping on top of the latest HR compliance requirements to creating and documenting enforcement policies to meet ever-changing HR compliance requirements to properly handling complaints when they occur—and more. 

There’s a lot at stake. In fact, the minute you hire your first employee, you introduce HR risk to your business. Each year, discrimination, wrongful termination, retaliation, and harassment claims cost U.S. businesses millions of dollars. For example, in 2023 the Equal Opportunity Employment Commission resolved 83,787 charges of workplace discrimination, resulting in $346.2 million in fines and settlements. Being out of HR compliance puts a business at risk for not only hefty fines and penalties but also reputational damage. Ultimately, all of this can be far more costly than investing in the resources to stay compliant. 

The shift to remote work over the past few years has resulted in many organizations having employees working in multiple locations and multiple states. This shift requires a strong understanding of and adherence to federal, state, and local employment rules and requirements. 

To better understand the current concerns and dynamics in the marketplace, TriNet sponsored research by Harvard Business Review Analytic Services, which conducted a pulse survey of business leaders, a majority of whom are from organizations that are evolving their operations to incorporate new strategies to keep up with compliance requirements, including the hiring of external HR service providers and the use of analytics tools. The report examines best practices -small and medium-sized businesses can use to navigate HR compliance and stay on top of changes to workplace rules and requirements. 

We hope you find it a valuable resource. 
‌
Michael Mendenhall 
Senior Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer/Chief Communications Officer, TriNet 

Download the Report →
 <https://app.hr.trinet.com/e/er?s=1487871083&lid=13497&elqTrackId=2898e8a1894841219b79944ef3b2bbc4&elq=c774976136b540a584c093d9c7735768&elqaid=9265&elqat=1&elqak=8AF581AB8190DEAA117E6F21FC5541A134B1F280EDC92C5C66498D7C309C37F2481C>                      

“ Employment legislation is dynamic and keeps undergoing changes, so companies need to ask themselves how they are managing and adapting to all of these changes.”

Priscila Bala
CEO 
LifeLabs Learning

Contents of Compliance Kit                

Compliance Calendar  with BONUS - eGuide and Checklist

HR Compliance Essentials:  from ADA to Record Retention.

Compliance with HR requirements is a multifaceted endeavor, encompassing many different aspects such as the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), workplace posters, employment agreements, and record retention, to name a few. The ADA and similar state laws mandate reasonable accommodations for employees with disabilities and prohibit discrimination based on disability status. Organizations must adhere to numerous posting requirements to inform employees of their rights, often as one compliance aspect of a broader law, such as paid sick and safe leave laws. Employment agreements and non-compete clauses can safeguard organizational interests but must be compliant with local, state, and federal requirements, some of which prohibit certain restrictive covenants, while meticulous record retention helps compliance and transparency throughout the employment lifecycle.
‌
Download the Calendar → 
<https://app.hr.trinet.com/e/er?s=1487871083&lid=13496&elqTrackId=14a811204c754d2994c99cae410b68e7&elq=c774976136b540a584c093d9c7735768&elqaid=9265&elqat=1&elqak=8AF5374001CD209CD7A52E068500D2FC575AF280EDC92C5C66498D7C309C37F2481C>                      

a person wearing glasses                  

What forms do you need to hire an independent contractor?  

Businesses often need to hire independent contractors (ICs) to perform work for which their regular employees don't have the time or skills. In this article, we'll review the tax forms and other documents companies must prepare for ICs. We'll also highlight two best practices for the use of written contracts and tracking of invoices. 

If it’s your first time hiring contractors, be aware that the Internal Revenue Service is aggressive in pursuing abuses of the tax system. So, you must take pains to determine whether an individual is a  legitimate contractor or employee. The difference is crucial because misclassification and failure to file the right 1099 form for contractors could result in significant fines and penalties.  
‌
Read the Article → 
<https://app.hr.trinet.com/e/er?s=1487871083&lid=13495&elqTrackId=b4883ec2fce944d18d194d8eae61ab53&elq=c774976136b540a584c093d9c7735768&elqaid=9265&elqat=1&elqak=8AF5C88AFC42AA028DCAAAA78DA1183DB8FEF280EDC92C5C66498D7C309C37F2481C>

Check out two compliance-themed events for some of the best insights and ideas on how to face and handle this tricky area of HR.

subject: Time to run payroll for Moona
body:
Gusto
[Gusto] (https://gusto.com)


### Heads up! ###
----------------------------------------


Hi Matt and Matt,

It’s almost time to pay your employees at Moona for their hard work. The next payroll will be for:

## Nov 25, 2024 – Dec 8, 2024 ##
----------------------------------------

*You have 3 days left to run payroll on time.* The deadline is 5:00PM MST on Wednesday, December 11.


Run Payroll Now (https://app.gusto.com/payrolls/new/7757518390175715/2024-12-08)
## Don’t wait til the last minute to run your final 2024 payrolls ##
----------------------------------------

Since December is a busy time for banks and payroll providers, we recommend running your final 2024 payrolls a few days earlier than usual—especially if you plan to make larger payments. It may also take us longer than usual to respond to requests for help.


Sincerely,
The Gusto team
